00033 #ifndef GTEST_INCLUDE_GTEST_GTEST_TEST_PART_H_
00034 #define GTEST_INCLUDE_GTEST_GTEST_TEST_PART_H_
00035 
00036 #include <iosfwd>
00037 #include <gtest/internal/gtest-internal.h>
00038 #include <gtest/internal/gtest-string.h>
00039 
00040 namespace testing {
00041 
00042 // The possible outcomes of a test part (i.e. an assertion or an
00043 // explicit SUCCEED(), FAIL(), or ADD_FAILURE()).
00044 enum TestPartResultType {
00045   TPRT_SUCCESS,           // Succeeded.
00046   TPRT_NONFATAL_FAILURE,  // Failed but the test can continue.
00047   TPRT_FATAL_FAILURE      // Failed and the test should be terminated.
00048 };
00049 
00050 // A copyable object representing the result of a test part (i.e. an
00051 // assertion or an explicit FAIL(), ADD_FAILURE(), or SUCCESS()).
00052 //
00053 // Don't inherit from TestPartResult as its destructor is not virtual.
00054 class TestPartResult {
00055  public:
00056   // C'tor.  TestPartResult does NOT have a default constructor.
00057   // Always use this constructor (with parameters) to create a
00058   // TestPartResult object.
00059   TestPartResult(TestPartResultType type,
00060                  const char* file_name,
00061                  int line_number,
00062                  const char* message)
00063       : type_(type),
00064         file_name_(file_name),
00065         line_number_(line_number),
00066         summary_(ExtractSummary(message)),
00067         message_(message) {
00068   }
00069 
00070   // Gets the outcome of the test part.
00071   TestPartResultType type() const { return type_; }
00072 
00073   // Gets the name of the source file where the test part took place, or
00074   // NULL if it's unknown.
00075   const char* file_name() const { return file_name_.c_str(); }
00076 
00077   // Gets the line in the source file where the test part took place,
00078   // or -1 if it's unknown.
00079   int line_number() const { return line_number_; }
00080 
00081   // Gets the summary of the failure message.
00082   const char* summary() const { return summary_.c_str(); }
00083 
00084   // Gets the message associated with the test part.
00085   const char* message() const { return message_.c_str(); }
00086 
00087   // Returns true iff the test part passed.
00088   bool passed() const { return type_ == TPRT_SUCCESS; }
00089 
00090   // Returns true iff the test part failed.
00091   bool failed() const { return type_ != TPRT_SUCCESS; }
00092 
00093   // Returns true iff the test part non-fatally failed.
00094   bool nonfatally_failed() const { return type_ == TPRT_NONFATAL_FAILURE; }
00095 
00096   // Returns true iff the test part fatally failed.
00097   bool fatally_failed() const { return type_ == TPRT_FATAL_FAILURE; }
00098  private:
00099   TestPartResultType type_;
00100 
00101   // Gets the summary of the failure message by omitting the stack
00102   // trace in it.
00103   static internal::String ExtractSummary(const char* message);
00104 
00105   // The name of the source file where the test part took place, or
00106   // NULL if the source file is unknown.
00107   internal::String file_name_;
00108   // The line in the source file where the test part took place, or -1
00109   // if the line number is unknown.
00110   int line_number_;
00111   internal::String summary_;  // The test failure summary.
00112   internal::String message_;  // The test failure message.
00113 };
00114 
00115 // Prints a TestPartResult object.
00116 std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& os, const TestPartResult& result);
00117 
00118 // An array of TestPartResult objects.
00119 //
00120 // We define this class as we cannot use STL containers when compiling
00121 // Google Test with MSVC 7.1 and exceptions disabled.
00122 //
00123 // Don't inherit from TestPartResultArray as its destructor is not
00124 // virtual.
00125 class TestPartResultArray {
00126  public:
00127   TestPartResultArray();
00128   ~TestPartResultArray();
00129 
00130   // Appends the given TestPartResult to the array.
00131   void Append(const TestPartResult& result);
00132 
00133   // Returns the TestPartResult at the given index (0-based).
00134   const TestPartResult& GetTestPartResult(int index) const;
00135 
00136   // Returns the number of TestPartResult objects in the array.
00137   int size() const;
00138  private:
00139   // Internally we use a list to simulate the array.  Yes, this means
00140   // that random access is O(N) in time, but it's OK for its purpose.
00141   internal::List<TestPartResult>* const list_;
00142 
00143   GTEST_DISALLOW_COPY_AND_ASSIGN_(TestPartResultArray);
00144 };
00145 
00146 // This interface knows how to report a test part result.
00147 class TestPartResultReporterInterface {
00148  public:
00149   virtual ~TestPartResultReporterInterface() {}
00150 
00151   virtual void ReportTestPartResult(const TestPartResult& result) = 0;
00152 };
00153 
00154 namespace internal {
00155 
00156 // This helper class is used by {ASSERT|EXPECT}_NO_FATAL_FAILURE to check if a
00157 // statement generates new fatal failures. To do so it registers itself as the
00158 // current test part result reporter. Besides checking if fatal failures were
00159 // reported, it only delegates the reporting to the former result reporter.
00160 // The original result reporter is restored in the destructor.
00161 // INTERNAL IMPLEMENTATION - DO NOT USE IN A USER PROGRAM.
00162 class HasNewFatalFailureHelper : public TestPartResultReporterInterface {
00163  public:
00164   HasNewFatalFailureHelper();
00165   virtual ~HasNewFatalFailureHelper();
00166   virtual void ReportTestPartResult(const TestPartResult& result);
00167   bool has_new_fatal_failure() const { return has_new_fatal_failure_; }
00168  private:
00169   bool has_new_fatal_failure_;
00170   TestPartResultReporterInterface* original_reporter_;
00171 
00172   GTEST_DISALLOW_COPY_AND_ASSIGN_(HasNewFatalFailureHelper);
00173 };
00174 
00175 }  // namespace internal
00176 
00177 }  // namespace testing
00178 
00179 #endif  // GTEST_INCLUDE_GTEST_GTEST_TEST_PART_H_
